abstract.p: Reggie Sinha letter on May 13 article urges Pakistan to extend moral and political support to its citizens stranded in Bangladesh when that nation became independent in 1971

block.p: Expressing its Islamic solidarity, Pakistan says it extends only moral and political support to the Kashmiris. Since charity begins at home, it would be nice if Pakistan extended this misdirected generosity to its own forsaken citizens now living in Bangladesh, those left behind in 1971 when East Pakistan became the independent Bangladesh (''Stranded Pakistanis Dreaming of Deliverance,'' front page, May 13).
REGGIE SINHA West Des Moines, Iowa May 13, 2000

Expressing its Islamic solidarity, Pakistan says it extends only moral and political support to the Kashmiris. Since charity begins at home, it would be nice if Pakistan extended this misdirected generosity to its own forsaken citizens now living in Bangladesh, those left behind in 1971 when East Pakistan became the independent Bangladesh (''Stranded Pakistanis Dreaming of Deliverance,'' front page, May 13).
REGGIE SINHA West Des Moines, Iowa May 13, 2000
